concept.title: How to move a file
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes how to move a single file to a different directory without renaming it.

conbody.p: You can move a single file to a different directory without renaming it, using RFs::Rename().

li.p: RFs::Replace() can also be used to move a file. The difference between the two functions is that Rename() will return an error if a file with the new name already exists in the target directory whereas Replace() will overwrite it. Another way to move files is to use CFileMan::Move(). This may be used to move multiple files.
